<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 121, 636, 145]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 175, 250]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 210, 425, 260]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 210, 905, 255]]<|/det|> <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 178, 293]]<|/det|> ## PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|> 9702/33 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 359, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 317]]<|/det|> October/November 2023 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 700, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: The materials and apparatus listed in the confidential instructions <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 230, 435]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 285, 450]]<|/det|> Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 808, 467]]<|/det|> Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|> Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|> Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|> Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|> Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 798, 544]]<|/det|> You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of 1 hour for each question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 892, 575]]<|/det|> You should record all your observations in the spaces provided in the question paper as soon as these observations are made. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 320, 590]]<|/det|> You may use a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 590, 578, 606]]<|/det|> You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 635, 220, 650]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 384, 666]]<|/det|> The total mark for this paper is 40. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 667, 729, 682]]<|/det|> The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[680, 720, 905, 851]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 868, 611, 884]]<|/det|> This document has 12 pages.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 740, 89]]<|/det|>
You may not need to use all of the materials provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 96, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 688, 120]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the oscillations of a pendulum.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 146, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 133, 544, 152]]<|/det|>
● Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 158, 794, 435]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 448, 532, 466]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 479, 175, 497]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 479, 920, 513]]<|/det|>
The length \(L\) of the pendulum is the distance between the bottom of the wooden blocks and the centre of the adhesive putty.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 526, 712, 544]]<|/det|>
Adjust the length of the string so that \(L\) is approximately \(53 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 558, 175, 575]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 558, 384, 575]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(L\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 616, 920, 635]]<|/det|>
<form>L = .................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 616, 920, 635]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 73, 918, 121]]<|/det|>
Use the second boss to attach the wooden rod to the stand. Adjust the apparatus until the vertical string of the pendulum just touches against the wooden rod, as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 128, 796, 400]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 413, 534, 433]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 446, 175, 464]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 446, 918, 479]]<|/det|>
The distance between the bottom of the wooden blocks and the centre of the wooden rod is \(S\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 491, 777, 510]]<|/det|>
Adjust the position of the wooden rod so that \(S\) is approximately \(36 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 523, 175, 541]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 523, 386, 541]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(S\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 583, 920, 602]]<|/det|>
<form>S = ....................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 616, 178, 634]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 616, 341, 634]]<|/det|>
Calculate \((L - S)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[507, 677, 920, 696]]<|/det|>
<form>(L - S) = .................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 710, 175, 727]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 708, 920, 742]]<|/det|>
Move the adhesive putty a small distance so that the string moves away from the wooden rod. Release the adhesive putty. The string hits the rod as the pendulum oscillates.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 756, 175, 774]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 755, 729, 774]]<|/det|>
Take measurements to determine the period \(T\) of the oscillations.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 894, 920, 912]]<|/det|>
<form>T = ............................................................ $s$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 910, 920, 927]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 918, 106]]<|/det|>
Change \(S\) in the range \(5.0 \text{cm} \leqslant S \leqslant 45.0 \text{cm}\) by adjusting the position of the wooden rod. Determine \(T\). Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(S\) and \(T\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 119, 737, 138]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\sqrt{(L - S)}\) in your table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 526, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 556, 144, 575]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 556, 175, 575]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 556, 702, 575]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of \(T\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\sqrt{(L - S)}\) on the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 556, 920, 575]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 586, 180, 605]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 586, 457, 605]]<|/det|>
Draw the straight line of best fit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 586, 920, 605]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 618, 180, 636]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 618, 608, 636]]<|/det|>
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[495, 836, 917, 855]]<|/det|>
<form>gradient = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 867, 917, 886]]<|/det|>
<form>y-intercept = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 884, 920, 902]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 185, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 72, 210, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 72, 584, 91]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 312, 588, 331]]<|/det|>

<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 344, 920, 377]]<|/det|>
Adjust the position of the boss so that the rod of the clamp is approximately \(0.30 \text{m}\) above the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 390, 215, 408]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 390, 920, 424]]<|/det|>
Use some of the adhesive putty to secure the \(30\mathrm{cm}\) ruler to the bench, as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 437, 213, 456]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 437, 920, 486]]<|/det|>
The raised end of the wooden strip is R, as shown in Fig. 2.2. Place the wooden strip on the rod and adjust the position of the stand so that the distance between the rod and R is approximately \(5\mathrm{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 500, 213, 518]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 500, 920, 549]]<|/det|>
Use adhesive putty to attach the mass to the wooden strip so that the distance \(d\) between the lower end of the wooden strip and the centre of the mass is approximately \(0.15 \text{m}\), as shown in Fig. 2.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 556, 816, 757]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 770, 534, 789]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[552, 833, 920, 851]]<|/det|>
